comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~steve-stevebaker

comments.content:
I had decided that tonight was the night I was going to fix this on the Cinder side, but alas I'm stuck.

The problem here is that we run into the odd case with nova booting an instance from a volume, compute API starts up the process, grabs the volume and makes the attach (so now the volume status is "in-use").  Then while it's booting something goes very wrong in nova (as can be seen by the multitudes of traces in the n-api logs) so we punch out and call tearDown.

The problem is we never cleaned up the volume-status, so it's still listed as "in-use" but the tearDown is a neat little loop on "thing.delete" so it's not accounting for things like removing attachments etc.

I was thinking doCleanup but realized that won't work because it's called "after" tearDown which is what fails.  So the only thing I can think of that's practical as a hack is to add a "if isinstance Volume" in the delete loop and change the state using the admin api to available so that teardown can do it's thing.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~john-griffith

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/74272
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: Is this still happening? Is this a nova bug or a cinder bug?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: I'm going to mark as invalid. I think there is a meta bug here which is the race between Nova and Cinder that gets a bunch of other symptoms, but we don't have a great reproduce for it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content: The proposed patch (https://review.openstack.org/74272) is abandoned. The current status of the bug is "In progress". So moving to "New".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ylobankov

comments.content: It looks like this issue is not reproduced anymore. At least I cannot reproduce it. So moving the status to "Incomplete". Anyway, who will encounter the issue feel free to move the status back.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ylobankov

comments.content: This problem seems never happens and no activity over one year, so let's mark this as invalid.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~oomichi
